pr_title: Issue #166 - Replica.updateMetastore calls metastore with batched partition lists.

timeline.message:
Merge pull request #1 from HotelsDotCom/master

merge upstream master into my branch
Issue 166 - call metastore with batched partition lists

timeline.bodyText:
shouldn't this be sublist instead of partitionsToAlter.
client.alter_partitions(replicaDatabaseName, replicaTableName, partitionsToAlter);
timeline.author: abhimanyugupta07

timeline.bodyText: here too. sublist instead of statisticsToSet ?
timeline.author: abhimanyugupta07

timeline.bodyText: I think to test the batching for alter_partition and setPartitionColumnStatistics usecase, it will be nice to have more than one existing partitions.
timeline.author: abhimanyugupta07

replies.bodyText: Yeah, it feels like we are missing some tests that would have caught the issues you called out above. I'd suggest writing new tests (or modifying existing) and getting them to fail with the current code and then fixing the code and they should then pass.
replies.author: massdosage

replies.bodyText: hmm, I agree with adding more tests for for alter_partition and setPartitionColumnStatistics but how would you suggest I get current(old) code to fail?  I guess I could mock a failure of the metastore client if the size of the list was longer than the partitionBatchSize, but that seems fairly contrived and not really testing anything except my ability to mock stuff.
replies.author: barnharts4

replies.bodyText: or maybe you didn't mean the issue of overwhelming the HMS with the full list, but rather the issue that I forgot to use sublist above?  In that case, yes, good point.
replies.author: barnharts4

replies.bodyText: Yes. Your last comment is what I meant. Just adding two more existing partitions in the test should give you a batch to trigger the changes you made.
replies.author: abhimanyugupta07

timeline.bodyText: Minor, but these imports should go along with the other google imports. I've made a mental note to update our hotels-oss-parent with a plugin that automatically does this that we've started using in EG org on GitHub so this is automated by Maven.
timeline.author: massdosage

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I am struggling with the correct IntelliJ settings to match circus train's preferred import layout.  Obviously DSP standards are not matching up well with HCOM in this circumstance. Do you have a doc or a settings file or something so that I can update?
replies.author: barnharts4

replies.bodyText:
This will do it once I've merged and released the parent - https://github.com/HotelsDotCom/circus-train/pull/168/files
I'm getting timeouts publishing to Maven Central right now, they've had lots of scalability issues in the last few months so I'm going to leave it for today and try again tomorrow.
replies.author: massdosage

timeline.bodyText: NABD but you could inline this on line 77 and then only have the assignment in the constructor below which actually allows you to override the value.
timeline.author: massdosage
massdosage

replies.bodyText: It was copied from the other constructor, and it means that this constructor is package-private and to construct this, you need to use ReplicaFactory.
replies.author: barnharts4

timeline.bodyText: I've never come across Lists.partition before, looks good.
timeline.author: massdosage

timeline.bodyText: I know it's not the most readable format but our import ordering is this: https://github.com/ExpediaGroup/eg-oss-parent/blob/master/pom.xml#L102
timeline.author: massdosage

replies.bodyText: ah, thanks, just what I was looking for!
replies.author: barnharts4

timeline.message: PR comments, restructure test to accomodate any number of altered/added partitions, and test combinations
add releaese data to changelog - let's be optimistic

timeline.bodyText: For another day but I wonder if we could use JUnit's "parameterised" feature to do this.
timeline.author: massdosage

replies.bodyText: I looked into that, but found references to Parameterized not working with MockitoJUnitRunner (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/12606148/passing-parameterized-input-using-mockitos) so I didn't pursue further in the interest of time.  But yes, that would be the perfect for this situation.
replies.author: barnharts4

replies.bodyText: Ah, OK. We should move to JUnit5 at some point as then it can definitely be done, see https://github.com/ExpediaGroup/beekeeper/blob/master/beekeeper-path-scheduler-apiary/src/test/java/com/expediagroup/beekeeper/scheduler/filter/WhitelistedListenerEventFilterTest.java
replies.author: massdosage
